author: Gab Hernandez
description:
It’s fascinating to see the surge in popularity for Dune in recent years, and the movies are 99% of the reason why.  As iconic as the Dune books were, their previous cinematic adaptations didn’t quite hit those blockbuster numbers. Denis Villeneuve’s back-to-back box office hits meant Dune gained a massive surge of new fans. Coinciding with this boom came the social deduction board game, Dune Betrayal.

Continue reading Grab this neat little Dune board game for less than a cup of coffee
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Grab this neat little Dune board game for less than a cup of coffee

author: Cat Bussell
description:
Dungeons & Dragons Art & Arcana: A Visual History is going for staggeringly cheap at the moment, offering fans old and new a tantalising trip through DnD’s storied and fascinating artistic history.

Continue reading Save precious gold on this DnD artbook full of timeless visuals

title: Save precious gold on this DnD artbook full of timeless visuals

author: Gab Hernandez
description:
Warhammer: Age of Sigmar features quite the roster of unique races, and the Idoneth Deepkin are a peak example of that. Whenever people think of “elves”, the lush forests of high elves or seedy underground cities of the dark elves come to mind first. This Sunday's preview showcases an altogether different kind of elf: one fueled by an obsession with souls.

Continue reading The Idoneth Deepkin surge into battle in this Warhammer: Age of Sigmar preview
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Warhammer Age of Sigmar armies guide, Age of Sigmar Kharadron Overlords guide, Age of Sigmar Stormcast Eter
title: The Idoneth Deepkin surge into battle in this Warhammer: Age of Sigmar preview

author: Chloe Ward
description:
If you love Pokémon TCG as much as I do, maybe you tuned into the 2025 Pokémon North American International Championships (NAIC) on Twitch a couple of weekends ago, and saw Isaiah Bradner take home first prize in the masters division with their Gardevoir EX deck. It was a big $25,000 win for Bradner - but a bigger milestone for Gardevoir EX, as it officially became the first Pokémon TCG deck archetype ever to make $1 million in tournament prizes.

Continue reading After huge tournament win, Gardevoir is Pokémon TCG's first million-dollar deck
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards,
title: After huge tournament win, Gardevoir is Pokémon TCG's first million-dollar deck
